page.title: 17Warslow Gala
page.content: Warslow Gala is always held on the second Saturday in August and has been going for 13 years. The Gala starts with a procession through the village. There are two floats, one for the present Gala Queen and the other for the retiring Queen. The Warslow Silver Band leads the procession. There is a fancy dress competition which used to be just for children but is now open to adults too. During the day there are a variety of stalls in the village hall. There used to be an old-time fair, but the owner died about two years ago and there are now more modern rides. In the evening there is a dance at the Village Hall and the Greyhound pub usually run a bar.
